discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Flask web application (Dalgona Challenges) - Python 2.7.18, Werkzeug 1.0.1 - Port 5001
localhost:5001/ - Homepage endpoint - GET only - Returns static HTML landing page
localhost:5001/static/ - Static files directory - CSS, images, assets served - Directory listing disabled
localhost:5001/static/img/logo5_white.png - Logo image - 346699 bytes - PNG format
localhost:5001/static/img/cookies/new_star.png - Star icon image - 3944073 bytes - PNG format

targets.objective: Test Flask application for: Python 2.7.18 vulnerabilities (EOL version), Werkzeug development server exposure, missing security headers (no X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options), and Flask-specific vulnerabilities (debug mode, SSTI, session security)
targets.rationale: CRITICAL - Running end-of-life Python 2.7.18 with no security updates. Flask development server (Werkzeug) exposed in production. No security headers implemented. Referenced challenge endpoint (/xss25) returns 404, suggesting incomplete deployment or hidden functionality.

targets.objective: Test static file serving for: path traversal vulnerabilities, directory listing information disclosure, exposure of sensitive files (.git, .env, backup files, source code), and unrestricted file access
targets.rationale: Static files are served without apparent restrictions. Need to verify no sensitive files are accessible and directory traversal is properly prevented.

targets.objective: Test homepage for: XSS via query parameters (application references XSS challenges), SQL/NoSQL injection if parameters are processed, template injection (SSTI with Jinja2), and parameter pollution attacks
targets.rationale: Homepage shows no reflection of query parameters but application is designed for XSS challenges. Need to identify if any hidden parameters trigger functionality or if the xss25 challenge can be accessed via parameters.

targets.objective: Test HTTP method handling: POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH methods on root endpoint, OPTIONS disclosure, method-based authentication bypass, and verb tampering vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Currently only GET, HEAD, OPTIONS allowed on root. POST returns 405. Need to verify if other endpoints accept dangerous HTTP methods or if method override headers work.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] End-of-life Python 2.7.18 in use - No longer receives security updates since January 2020
[CRITICAL] Werkzeug development server exposed - Not suitable for production use, lacks security features
[CRITICAL] No security headers implemented - Missing X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security, X-XSS-Protection, X-Content-Type-Options
[HIGH] Referenced XSS challenge endpoint returns 404 - /xss25 linked from homepage but non-functional, suggests incomplete deployment or access control
[MEDIUM] No session management detected - No cookies set, no authentication mechanism observed
[MEDIUM] Minimal attack surface - Only 2 functional endpoints discovered (root and static files)
[LOW] Directory listing disabled - /static/ returns 404, proper configuration
[LOW] Error pages provide minimal information - Generic 404 responses with no stack traces or debug info
[INFO] Application title: Dalgona Challenges - Security challenge/training platform
[INFO] Single challenge referenced - XSS 25, but endpoint not accessible via standard methods
